column5: I'm looking for a good quality vice under $100, I'm not looking for anything super special I've been using a AA vice for a few years and I can't stand it, half the time the hook slips out when you tying and it is impossible to tighten, any suggestions?
I use an Apex and a Integra. Both are good vise's.

I don't know about under $100 but I am now using a Renzeti Traveler and it is a sweet vise. The jaws grip like crazy and it's a rotary. Unfortunately it is double what you're looknig to spend, but if you can swing the extra $$$$ you won't be sorry.  I'm sure you will get plenty of responses of vises in your price bracket.
Thanks Chrisk (That's my name too) both vices look good, I'm gonna wait and see what other recommendations come in.
I was giving a vise some consideration and found this site in my travelsâ€¦pretty good read I think. http://www.flyfishohio.com/Vise%20Review%201/Fly_Tying_Vise_Shoot-Out.htm
I've had a Thompson Original Pro II Vice for almost 30 years and love it.  My link
Thanks ww I think I might check out the Danica DanVise.
I've heard good things about the Danvises.
